    M5 Forecasting challenges Preparing input

    Prepare arrays (tensors), which can be used a

    make_arrays.Rd

    Prepare arrays (tensors), which can be used a

    Usage

    make_arrays(
  data,
  key,
  index,
  lookback,
  horizon,
  stride = 1,
  shuffle = TRUE,
  sample_frac = 1,
  target,
  numeric = NULL,
  categorical = NULL,
  static = NULL,
  past = NULL,
  future = NULL,
  by_key = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data.frame object

    key

    Columns, which creates unique time series IDs

    index

    A time-related column

    lookback

    The length of the context from the past

    horizon

    The forecast length

    stride

    Stride of the moving window

    shuffle

    Shuffle samples. Set FALSE for the test dataset.

    target

    Target variable(s)

    numeric

    Numeric variables

    categorical

    Categorical variables

    static

    Static variables

    Examples

    library(m5)

make_arrays(
  data = tiny_m5,
  key = c('item_id', 'store_id'),
  index = 'date',
  lookback = 28,
  horizon = 28
)
#>              item_id store_id start_time   end_time
#>   1:   HOBBIES_1_330     CA_1 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#>   2: HOUSEHOLD_1_272     CA_1 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#>   3:     FOODS_2_181     CA_1 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#>   4:     FOODS_2_360     CA_1 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#>   5:     FOODS_3_080     CA_1 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#>  ---                                               
#> 276: HOUSEHOLD_1_474     WI_3 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#> 277: HOUSEHOLD_1_521     WI_3 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#> 278:     FOODS_1_046     WI_3 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#> 279:     FOODS_1_218     WI_3 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
#> 280:     FOODS_3_702     WI_3 2011-01-29 2016-04-24
